intro: Andromeda ligustrina var. foliosiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf andromeda, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to form dense, compact shrubs. Its leaves are broad and glossy, adding visual interest throughout the growing season.
